discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Multi-factor authentication (MFA) requires users to provide more than just a username and password to authenticate. In this scenario, the user provides their credentials (username and password) followed by a passcode from their phone application, which constitutes a second factor of authentication

questions.question_text: After providing a username and password, a user must input a passcode from a phone application. Which of the following authentication technologies is used in this example?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Warm site: Partial setup with some equipment, software, and data, requiring moderate activation time (like B).

choices.D: A full infrastructure in place, but no current data on site
choices.B: A partial infrastructure, software, and data on site
choices.C: A full electrical infrastructure in place, but no customer devices on site
choices.A: A combination of public and private loud services to restore data

questions.question_text: Which of the following facilities is the best example of a warm site in the event of information system disruption?
Which of the following services runs on port 636?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
LDAPS uses port 636

Selected Answer: D
Content filtering examines the data being transmitted over the network and can block specific types of content or websites based on predefined policies. This is the most suitable method for restricting access to social media platforms and personal cloud storage as it can identify and block specific websites or content related to those services.

questions.question_text: A company wants to implement data loss prevention by restricting user access to social media platforms and personal cloud storage on workstations. Which of the following types of filtering should the company deploy to achieve these goals?

choices.A: Implementing additional ad hoc access points
choices.D: Changing the current frequency of the Wi-Fi
choices.C: Deploying a mesh network in the building
choices.B: Providing more Ethernet drops for user connections

questions.question_text: An organization is struggling to get effective coverage using the wireless network. The organization wants to implement a solution that will allow for continuous connectivity anywhere in the facility. Which of the following should the network administrator suggest to ensure the best coverage?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
A mesh network consists of multiple access points (APs) that work together to create a seamless network. This means that as a device moves through the building, it automatically connects to the nearest AP, providing uninterrupted coverage. This is ideal for large facilities with many obstacles that can weaken the signal from a single router.
